thread.title: Mets pitcher Steven Matz on roster for series vs. Dodgers - Sports
thread.title_full: Mets pitcher Steven Matz on roster for series vs. Dodgers - Sports - NorthJersey.com

author: MATT EHALT
title: Mets pitcher Steven Matz on roster for series vs. Dodgers - Sports
text:
LOS ANGELES - Pitcher Steven Matz  is on the Mets' National League Division Series roster and could start Game 4 of the series if it advances that far.
The lefthander was the one player the Mets were uncertain about for the NLDS against the Dodgers as his stiff back/back spasms forced him to miss his last scheduled start in the regular season.
Matz threw a simulated game Thursday consisting of approximately 90 pitches, and the team had to see how he felt after playing catch Friday before determining his status.
It's not known yet if he is on the roster as a reliever or a starter, but manager Terry Collins said Friday the plan would be for Matz to start Game 4.
The Mets have 14 position players and 11 pitchers on their roster for their first playoff series in nine years.
Jacob deGrom faces Clayton Kershaw tonight in Game 1.

Mets' NLDS roster: 
Catchers (2): Travis d'Arnaud; Kevin Plawecki

Infielders (6): Lucas Duda; Kelly Johnson; Daniel Murphy; Ruben Tejada; Wilmer Flores; David Wright

Outfielders (6): Michael Cuddyer; Michael Conforto; Yoenis Cespedes; Juan Lagares; Kirk Nieuwenhuis; Curtis Granderson

Starting pitchers (4): Jacob deGrom, Noah Syndergaard, Matt Harvey, Steven Matz

Relief pitchers (7): Jeurys Familia, Tyler Clippard, Addison Reed, Hansel Robles, Erik Goeddel, Bartolo Colon, Jon Niese
